Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Left ventricular alpha and beta adrenoceptor densities were also reduced compared to controls .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| alpha adrenoceptor |
| beta adrenoceptor |

In the given paragraph, the two chemical entities are "alpha adrenoceptor" and "beta adrenoceptor." These are types of adrenoceptors, which are proteins that bind to and respond to adrenaline and noradrenaline (also known as epinephrine and norepinephrine, respectively). The alpha and beta adrenoceptors are further divided into subtypes, such as alpha-1, alpha-2, beta-1, and beta-2 adrenoceptors, which have different functions and are found in different tissues throughout the body. In this paragraph, the specific subtypes are not mentioned, so I have simply used the general terms "alpha adrenoceptor" and "beta adrenoceptor."

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| alpha adrenoceptor |
| beta adrenoceptor |

In the given paragraph, the two chemical entities are "alpha adrenoceptor" and "beta adrenoceptor." These are types of adrenoceptors, which are proteins that bind to and respond to adrenaline and noradrenaline (also known as epinephrine and norepinephrine, respectively). The alpha and beta adrenoceptors are further divided into subtypes, such as alpha-1, alpha-2, beta-1, and beta-2 adrenoceptors, which have different functions and are found in different tissues throughout the body. In this paragraph, the specific subtypes are not mentioned, so I have simply used the general terms "alpha adrenoceptor" and "beta adrenoceptor."

The other terms in the paragraph, such as "left ventricular" and "controls," do not refer to chemicals, so they have been omitted from the table. "Left ventricular" refers to the left ventricle of the heart, which is responsible for pumping oxygenated blood out of the heart and into the rest of the body. "Controls" refers to a group of individuals who do not have the condition being studied and who are used as a comparison group in research studies.
